businessProfile.name: The StopAlong
businessProfile.address: 1812 N Milwaukee Ave, Chicago, IL 60647, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 1812 N Milwaukee Ave, Chicago, IL 60647, USA

reviews.text:
Great food and friendly vibes, but be prepared for a warm, breezy (and buggy) atmosphere. It was pretty hot inside with no A/C and the doors open, which let in some mosquitos. Though to be fair, they always find me.

Still, the food was great. We tried the burgers, salads, and pizza, and everything was genuinely delicious.

The service was kind and welcoming, though not super knowledgeable about the menu or beers. Also, the server depended on us to remember what we ordered and some of us started eating the wrong salads (main dish versus side salads).

Overall, a solid spot. Maybe bring bug spray if you‚Äôre mosquito-prone and sitting inside (or out) on a summer night.

One of the very few places deserving of a 5 star. This place is AMAZING. The service is great and the food is phenomenal. First time I have a 10/10 pizza and a 10/10 burger from the same place! The fries are fine I would say 7/10. Chicken is 7/10 as well. No one can have it all but burger and pizza top notch especially with the declining small cheval, this is a winner. Keep up the great service and great food! (Excuse my poor photography skills) . pro tip: go to the restaurant exactly when the time says to be there, don‚Äôt go too early. They are efficient and plan well

I stopped by The StopAlong for a quick lunch meeting and was pleasantly surprised. The pizza was delicious‚Äîloved the crunchiness of the crust! I also tried the burger, and it was just as good. Great flavors, quality food, and all at an affordable price. Definitely worth a visit!

Stopped in before Chicago artist‚Äôs Don‚Äôt Fret memorial, which was held in Park 567 across the street. Friendly and quick service, excellent White Pie (with added fresh basil) and Short-Stop Burger, both recommended. The toys and artwork are bright and cheerful but the space still seems somehow not alive, our only criticism.

One of the best smash burgers in the city. Cool arcade and 80s nerd memorabilia. Great for kids to grown ups. Great chicago handshake burger and fries for $20.
Only complaint is half the staff are really kind and the others give you the gen z stare most of the time. Im a millennial. I still like small talk and kindness.

editorial_summary.overview: Pizza, burgers, salads & soft serve offered in 1980s-inspired digs with a full bar & arcade games.

issues: Mobile performance data unavailable - API configuration required

Test website on mobile devices manually

recentReviews.text: We were here today and ordered pizza, one of which was very spicy... (The waitress was great and very polite. Very beautiful interior of the pizzeria, clean toilets, overall the atmosphere is like from childhood))) The food is not bad, but not wow, I think it is because we do not know yet what from the menu is really tasty and we will like it, anyway thanks
We love this neighborhood place.  Gluten free pizza is actually the best we've tried.  My spouse loves the burger.  Service is always superb!

We love love love The StopAlong. Both locations are great- kid friendly & awesome service. The pizza (all the right moves) and the burger are AMAZING! They also give back to the community. Could not recommend enough!

Just when I thought I couldn‚Äôt love them more, we hosted a party at the Logan Square location- it exceeded my expectations! Robert is a gem of a human! And Kelly, our server, was phenomenal! Everyone had what they needed at all times. 10/10

Great food and friendly vibes, but be prepared for a warm, breezy (and buggy) atmosphere. It was pretty hot inside with no A/C and the doors open, which let in some mosquitos. Though to be fair, they always find me.

Still, the food was great. We tried the burgers, salads, and pizza, and everything was genuinely delicious.

The service was kind and welcoming, though not super knowledgeable about the menu or beers. Also, the server depended on us to remember what we ordered and some of us started eating the wrong salads (main dish versus side salads).

Overall, a solid spot. Maybe bring bug spray if you‚Äôre mosquito-prone and sitting inside (or out) on a summer night.
Really good place for a burger, wood fired pizza and/or a beer. They even had "the Blues Brothers" playing on the tv.
Wonderful pickup experience. Played some arcade games while waiting as I arrived early.  Good was excellent and manager gave burger candy to daughter on way out. Excellent as always.

detailedReviews.author: –ï–ª–∏–∑–∞–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –ö—É–∑–∏–Ω–∞

Very beautiful interior of the pizzeria, clean toilets, overall the atmosphere is like from childhood))) The food is not bad, but not wow, I think it is because we do not know yet what from the menu is really tasty and we will like it, anyway thanks

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Valdez
detailedReviews.text: We love this neighborhood place.  Gluten free pizza is actually the best we've tried.  My spouse loves the burger.  Service is always superb!

detailedReviews.author: Brad Stevison
detailedReviews.text: Hot and delicious

detailedReviews.author: Megan Razim-Goetter
detailedReviews.text:
We love love love The StopAlong. Both locations are great- kid friendly & awesome service. The pizza (all the right moves) and the burger are AMAZING! They also give back to the community. Could not recommend enough!

Just when I thought I couldn‚Äôt love them more, we hosted a party at the Logan Square location- it exceeded my expectations! Robert is a gem of a human! And Kelly, our server, was phenomenal! Everyone had what they needed at all times. 10/10

detailedReviews.author: Stacy A
detailedReviews.text:
Great food and friendly vibes, but be prepared for a warm, breezy (and buggy) atmosphere. It was pretty hot inside with no A/C and the doors open, which let in some mosquitos. Though to be fair, they always find me.

Still, the food was great. We tried the burgers, salads, and pizza, and everything was genuinely delicious.

The service was kind and welcoming, though not super knowledgeable about the menu or beers. Also, the server depended on us to remember what we ordered and some of us started eating the wrong salads (main dish versus side salads).

Overall, a solid spot. Maybe bring bug spray if you‚Äôre mosquito-prone and sitting inside (or out) on a summer night.

detailedReviews.author: Tim Smith
detailedReviews.text: Really good place for a burger, wood fired pizza and/or a beer. They even had "the Blues Brothers" playing on the tv.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Barry
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful pickup experience. Played some arcade games while waiting as I arrived early.  Good was excellent and manager gave burger candy to daughter on way out. Excellent as always.

detailedReviews.author: Julia B
detailedReviews.text: Neighborhood gem for a unique and affordable dining experience. Pizzas have fresh toppings and a crispy, wood-fired crust. A go-to for a classic burger and fries. Can't go wrong!

detailedReviews.author: Alpesh Shah
detailedReviews.text: Always great dine in or carry out!

detailedReviews.author: Susie Kirkwood
detailedReviews.text: This is such a great place for families. Also perfect when you have a party of both vegans and nonvegans - great food for all!

detailedReviews.author: Stephen B
detailedReviews.text: Food and service is great! Sometimes there are just too many kiddos running around tho. I miss the more adult atmosphere. Still great pizza tho!

detailedReviews.author: Lauren Padgett
detailedReviews.text: Always a fantastic experience with the stopalong!! I have loved them for years!

detailedReviews.author: Samantha Flora
detailedReviews.text: Stop Along is one of our go to spots for carry out or dine-in for dinner. The food is always top notch. When we dine in our son has fun playing games while he waits. 10/10 would recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Oliver Heidekat
detailedReviews.text:
One of the best smash burgers in the city. Cool arcade and 80s nerd memorabilia. Great for kids to grown ups. Great chicago handshake burger and fries for $20.
Only complaint is half the staff are really kind and the others give you the gen z stare most of the time. Im a millennial. I still like small talk and kindness.

detailedReviews.author: Yesenia Garcia
detailedReviews.text: Love the smashBurger it was great and love the atmosphere!

detailedReviews.author: Dafeng Chen
detailedReviews.text: I tried the StopAlong burger at Roscoe Village Burgerfest; I got it without cheese and the burger slapped even though I firmly believe every burger should have cheese on it. It's clear why it's a step above every other competitor. I saw the cooks actually using ground beef and forming the patties for their smash burger. Literally every other competitor was using some stock bulk preformed patty that was likely frozen.

detailedReviews.author: Pat O'Neil
detailedReviews.text:
DO NOT SIT AT THE BAR. If you're ordering online this should be a good pizza. If you are in person, your results may vary.  I live down the street and really love the pizza, but if you're ordering in person you are going to have a bad time. I sat at the bar, ordered a beer and pizza to-go and watched 30 pizzas go out immaculate.  My personal pizza was the only burned on in the bunch - an hour later.

Ultimately,  this a remote order location. Don't waste your time physically showing up - that will only lead to the longest wait time of your life, but also a pizza that takes second place to mobile orders.

detailedReviews.author: Pinal Patel
detailedReviews.text: Awesome pizza!!

detailedReviews.author: Dave Xa
detailedReviews.text: One of the very few places deserving of a 5 star. This place is AMAZING. The service is great and the food is phenomenal. First time I have a 10/10 pizza and a 10/10 burger from the same place! The fries are fine I would say 7/10. Chicken is 7/10 as well. No one can have it all but burger and pizza top notch especially with the declining small cheval, this is a winner. Keep up the great service and great food! (Excuse my poor photography skills) . pro tip: go to the restaurant exactly when the time says to be there, don‚Äôt go too early. They are efficient and plan well

detailedReviews.author: Maria Duque
detailedReviews.text:
I love having the StopAlong nearby. It's my favorite pizza I've tried in Chicago so far, although it might be hit or miss in terms of freshness for carryout.
The burger and fries are very good as well, although at almost $20 it's not the best value.
The location is nice too, with some outdoor seating and arcade games in the back.

detailedReviews.author: E Disney
detailedReviews.text:
From 12/31/24 order...We ordered two pizzas, a double sausage pizza and a vegetarian pizza to share with friends we love stop along! Favorite pizza crust just the right amount of sauce. Plenty of cheese and toppings. Never go wrong here. From today...great deal BOGO pizza so we fed city water maintenance crew replacing our giant water pipes on our street.
7/8/25 pizza was perfect.

detailedReviews.author: kassidy brown
detailedReviews.text: Amazing burger!!! So tasty

detailedReviews.author: Jake B.
detailedReviews.text: Really good pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Robert Perez
detailedReviews.text: They have perfected their food because their menu is straightforward. Smash burger is great but it would have to be because they are down the street from Small Cheval. The pizza has great dough and ingredients, but I do wish the sauce was less bland. The cocktail was well balanced. Nostalgic atmosphere is cool too. This place is a reliable, straightforward, and a enjoyment focused experience that I would/will revisit.

detailedReviews.author: David Smith
detailedReviews.text: One of my favorite places in Chicago! Been here dozens of times over the years. Amazing smash burger. Pizza is pretty good (not incredible). Always a good vibe. Love the ninja turtle theme.

detailedReviews.author: Imad Zoubai
detailedReviews.text: Great burgers and can't go wrong with the Chicago handshake deal they got.

detailedReviews.author: Brandon Lewis
detailedReviews.text: The Stop Along... The burger is üî•! Perfect diner style burger, it's cispy and juicy! The atmosphere is super chill and gotta love the vintage 80's action figures! The servers, bartenders, cooks and the owner are amazing people, which is why I come at least once a month. It's the best place to be a regular!

detailedReviews.author: Michael Joseph
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food and atmosphere

detailedReviews.author: shannon fanning
detailedReviews.text: Smash burger was alright. I feel as though it was a little too wet. The bun is pretty bad. if you live around and the area and are craving it should hit the spot. Pizza was pretty good nothing too special but the char is definitely it's savior, pretty pricy for a 10inch -$18. Beer are good and fair priced

detailedReviews.author: Tiffany Vianna
detailedReviews.text: Stopalong is our go to!  Best burgers and pizza in the city and a great, casual environment with free arcade games our kids love!

detailedReviews.author: Brooke Houghton
detailedReviews.text: Love, love, love the pizza! We had a party of 10 - 5 adults and 5 teens. Perfect place for all of us on a Thursday night. Wait staff was great - quick and accommodating. Definitely a win and a great way to kick off summer!

detailedReviews.author: Levi Napier
detailedReviews.text: Great neighborhood spot. Burger is out of this world

detailedReviews.author: Kovas Palubinskas
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in before Chicago artist‚Äôs Don‚Äôt Fret memorial, which was held in Park 567 across the street. Friendly and quick service, excellent White Pie (with added fresh basil) and Short-Stop Burger, both recommended. The toys and artwork are bright and cheerful but the space still seems somehow not alive, our only criticism.

detailedReviews.author: Teresa Candelario
detailedReviews.text: I went here on a Friday evening with my (adult) son. I really enjoyed the 80s vibe, but I gotta say: it was very much a family place. There were two tables that had a baby. The pizza was good, but really not great. More NY style than Chicago style. The slice hangs when you pick it up. That is not for me, my friend.

detailedReviews.author: Felix Vogele (HUGWOLF)
detailedReviews.text: Tasty burger

detailedReviews.author: Serena Starks
detailedReviews.text: StopAlong has exceptional customer service. Robert was incredibly helpful and warm while helping me coordinate a company lunch. The food was amazing and the whole group seemed satisfied with trying a new place. I would definitely use StopAlong again for company events in the future!

detailedReviews.author: Rolando Palacios
detailedReviews.text: Went to this place based on online recommendations. I ordered the StopAlong burger. They have potential but my sandwich was too salty. There was salt on the meat and some of the toppings which combined for too much salt overall. My son had a small pizza and that was too salty as well, even he thought so. The server offered to bring me a different entree but all they have are burgers and pizza. The chef needs to reset their palate so they don't use so much salt.

detailedReviews.author: Gerald Bockwinkel
detailedReviews.text: Great food.  Great value.  Fast service.

detailedReviews.author: Olivia Hall
detailedReviews.text: Stop along never misses. I‚Äôve always gotten pizza there (so good!) but just tried their burger for the first time. I was impressed! Also, sign up for their rewards, they have great coupons. Only call out is that there are TONS of kids when we dine in, but if you‚Äôre a parent, that‚Äôs probably a plus!

detailedReviews.author: a l
detailedReviews.text:
EDIT: we went back 7 months after we first tried it, it was MUCH MUCH better our second try!!  so i changed the rating! buns were warm this time and food was better seasoned this time around

october 2024: Loved the 80s vibes, I am a big 80s fanatic so it definitely tickled my brain the right way.

The server was very nice too.

The burger was fine, it tastes like a homemade burger, which is NOT bad at all, but it does make me feel its overpriced for what it is.

I also wish the buns would be warmed up, I think if they warmed the bun it'd elevate the burger.

detailedReviews.author: Erick Melendez
detailedReviews.text: I stopped by The StopAlong for a quick lunch meeting and was pleasantly surprised. The pizza was delicious‚Äîloved the crunchiness of the crust! I also tried the burger, and it was just as good. Great flavors, quality food, and all at an affordable price. Definitely worth a visit!

detailedReviews.author: Eric Miller
detailedReviews.text: Classic 80s vibe with a solid menu. Great for a quick bite or a last stop after the bar. Plenty of Gluten free options were a huge win for us and the Animal Fries seemed a bit scary on the menu but we're sooo good.

detailedReviews.author: Alex Richardson
detailedReviews.text: A big concern of mine when entering burger places is when the burger is stacked with an immense amount of salt and onion to mask the flavor of the ingredients, and that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve noticed within this burger. I ordered the burger meal with fries, and I wasn‚Äôt fully satisfied with this place. Many people told me that this burger spot had amazing burgers for its value, so I decided to see how it would fare against other burger spots In this case, it wasn‚Äôt all great. It‚Äôs a solid burger, but far too expensive when I can get 2 or 3 burgers at local competitors. My advice - focus on the flavor within the burger and avoid the excessive flavour masking. 6.5/10.

detailedReviews.author: Jenny Lane
detailedReviews.text: Always the best

detailedReviews.author: Lucas East
detailedReviews.text: Best burger in the city. Order directly through their website - cheaper than door dash and more $ for these guys.

detailedReviews.author: Ali Dempsey
detailedReviews.text: A neighborhood favorite that never disappoints! We‚Äôve been ordering pizza for takeout for a while, but we decided to dine in this time. We all got burgers with either fries or a salad. ‚ÄúMom‚Äôs side salad‚Äù was amazing, and I‚Äôm obsessed with the lemon vinaigrette! The burgers were smashy and great, as were the fries. The atmosphere is lively and fun - though small inside we barely had to wait for a seat (5 min). Super friendly and fast service. We‚Äôll be back soon!

detailedReviews.author: Mike Mlynarczyk
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza spot!

detailedReviews.author: Steph Merucci
detailedReviews.text: My sister was visiting from LA and I ordered a large pizza and she ate half the pie and said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had‚Äù like 13 times

detailedReviews.author: Tim Allison
detailedReviews.text:
Some of the best New York style pizza you can get in Chicago. Plus they have a really good burger as well. My only complaint would be the prices have gone up a little you much over the years I've been going here. For me at least, it's getting a little outside the price range for the amount of food I'm getting.

Update 3/15/25: Prices are still a little high but the food has remained very tasty and fresh. Tried a new style pizza today, The Space Balls. Great option if you don't eat pork like myself and want some meat. Added pictures as well

detailedReviews.author: A Gonzalez
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in here after seeing some good reviews and it did not disappoint! The cheesy garlic bread has a beautiful pull that lets you know it‚Äôs going to be as good as it looks. And it was!! The burger was delicious and the cocktails were made to perfection. I will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Colin Bracken
detailedReviews.text: The pizza is always on point. That one pie with the hot honey and pepperoni is a great selection if you need something to quell the bad day you had at work.

detailedReviews.author: Shawn Riggins
detailedReviews.text: Great food and a great atmosphere

detailedReviews.author: Tony Blanco
detailedReviews.text: Burger diner with Star Wars and Super Mario decor. Thursday night special is a double smash burger off their list of custom burgers, fries (try the animal), a tall boy and a shot for $17. After your meal, there is a free arcade room in the back with stand up classics that include Donkey Kong, Mrs. Pac-Man, Tyson's Punch Out, and Galaga. Add The Stop Along to your list of Chicago must dos.

detailedReviews.author: Clare Stetson
detailedReviews.text: We‚Äôve been big fans of Stop Along for years! It‚Äôs top of our bucket list to show people when they visit from out of town. The food here is always fresh and delicious! Burgers are great and pizza is awesome. Can‚Äôt go wrong with the delicious garlic knots either!

detailedReviews.author: Yerim Noh
detailedReviews.text: Ordered pick-up from here and it was ready in a timely manner! Nice service. Food was good. I ordered wings - buffalo and BBQ - which were both really good! The chicken tenders were not for me - a little too fried, not enough meat on it. The burger was excellent with great fries too! Would come back, would recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Egan
detailedReviews.text: Friendliest staff in the business, and simple, delicious fare served up quickly and super family friendly. Free use of arcade games onsite. A safe environment where kids can play and parents can chill and catch up!

detailedReviews.author: Kayla
detailedReviews.text: Love the stopalong! I‚Äôm so thankful for the offering of vegan cheese! They give great coupons when you sign up for texts, and I always notice the owners being very active and generous within the community! Great food, relaxed vibe. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Nate Danger
detailedReviews.text: Tbh this is some of the best pizza by the slice you can get and the price can‚Äôt be beat. I‚Äôm frequent at emporium and to have this option for pizza just before I get home makes my night even better. 2 pepperoni slices and a Diet Coke lol my go to. Next thing to try is the fries lol totally recommend

detailedReviews.author: Nick Faldstein
detailedReviews.text: Such a fun spot. Love the food, love the atmosphere and just love it all!

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer Velasco
detailedReviews.text: Food is great. All the Right Moves is my go to pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Vargo
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great staff, great casual vibes. Stop Along rules.

detailedReviews.author: Frank Britton
detailedReviews.text: Ordered takeout upon hearing great burger. Was expecting something mediocre and degraded by delivery. But no. Frikken awesome burger and fries. Very happy and will order again and visit. üòÅ

detailedReviews.author: Vincent Ma√±ara
detailedReviews.text: Delicious burger. Good service.

detailedReviews.author: Fatemeh F
detailedReviews.text: The burger is amazing. I also liked the ambience.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Huffman
detailedReviews.text: Pizza and burgers are great.  Inside is great with a good beer selection as well

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Kim
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza around me. Owner is a super dude who gives to the community.

detailedReviews.author: Sally Fischer
detailedReviews.text: Great food. Friendly staff. A neighborhood staple. We are half way between the Bucktown and Logan Square locations and love them both.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.8/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the kid-friendly atmosphere and arcade games that keep children entertained while waiting. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The gluten-free pizza is praised as the best customers have tried, appealing to those with dietary restrictions. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The StopAlong is celebrated for its community involvement and giving back, which resonates deeply with patrons. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Inconsistent food quality and service experience (e.g., burnt pizza, overly salty dishes, and lack of staff knowledge) - review management can address this concern
Lack of awareness about the restaurant's ambiance and unique offerings (e.g., 80s vibe, arcade, family-friendly environment) - social media marketing can improve this area
Long wait times for in-person orders compared to online orders - Boostly marketing services can improve this

neutral.text:

Still, the food was great. We tried the burgers, salads, and pizza, and everything was genuinely delicious.

The service was kind and welcoming, though not super knowledgeable about the menu or beers. Also, the server depended on us to remember what we ordered and some of us started eating the wrong salads (main dish versus side salads).

Overall, a solid spot. Maybe bring bug spray if you‚Äôre mosquito-prone and sitting inside (or out) on a summer night.

neutral.text: Smash burger was alright. I feel as though it was a little too wet. The bun is pretty bad. if you live around and the area and are craving it should hit the spot. Pizza was pretty good nothing too special but the char is definitely it's savior, pretty pricy for a 10inch -$18. Beer are good and fair priced

neutral.text: Went to this place based on online recommendations. I ordered the StopAlong burger. They have potential but my sandwich was too salty. There was salt on the meat and some of the toppings which combined for too much salt overall. My son had a small pizza and that was too salty as well, even he thought so. The server offered to bring me a different entree but all they have are burgers and pizza. The chef needs to reset their palate so they don't use so much salt.

negative.text:
DO NOT SIT AT THE BAR. If you're ordering online this should be a good pizza. If you are in person, your results may vary.  I live down the street and really love the pizza, but if you're ordering in person you are going to have a bad time. I sat at the bar, ordered a beer and pizza to-go and watched 30 pizzas go out immaculate.  My personal pizza was the only burned on in the bunch - an hour later.

Ultimately,  this a remote order location. Don't waste your time physically showing up - that will only lead to the longest wait time of your life, but also a pizza that takes second place to mobile orders.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
